questions.q: Which antibiotic is most appropriate for treating community-acquired MRSA skin infections?
questions.explanation: Trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole is a first-line treatment for community-acquired MRSA infections

questions.q: What is the most common cause of viral meningitis?
questions.explanation: Enteroviruses are responsible for about 85% of viral meningitis cases

questions.q: Hyperextension of the fetal head is found in:
Stages of labor:
questions.A: The first stage commences at the time of membrane rupture
questions.B: The cervix dilates at a consistent rate of 3 cm per hour in the first stage
questions.C: The third stage ends with the delivery of the placenta and membranes
questions.D: Forceps or ventouse may be useful in slow progress of the late 1st stage
questions.E: Syntometrine is a combination of oxytocin and ergometrine, used in the treatment of secondary postpartum hemorrhage (PPH)
questions.explanation: The third stage of labor ends with the delivery of the placenta and membranes

questions.q: All the following characteristics are applied to a pelvis favorable to vaginal delivery EXCEPT:
questions.B: Obstetric conjugate is less than 10 cm
questions.E: Intertuberous diameter accepts 4 knuckles on pelvic exam

questions.q: In the fetus:
questions.A: The coronal suture lies between the two parietal bones
questions.B: The umbilical artery normally contains one artery and two veins
questions.C: Fetal lie describes the long axis of the fetus to the long axis of the mother
questions.D: Entanglement of the umbilical cord is common in diamniotic twins
questions.E: The anterior fontanelle is usually closed by the time of labor
questions.explanation: Fetal lie describes the long axis of the fetus to the long axis of the mother

questions.q: Which of the following terms best describes the pelvic type of small posterior sagittal diameter, convergent sidewalls, prominent ischial spines, and narrow pubic arch?
questions.explanation: Android pelvis has a small posterior sagittal diameter, convergent sidewalls, prominent ischial spines, and narrow pubic arch

questions.q: The second stage of labor involves:
questions.explanation: The second stage of labor ends with the expulsion of the fetus

questions.q: A pelvic inlet is felt to be contracted if:
questions.A: The anteroposterior diameter is only 12 cm
questions.B: The transverse diameter is only 10 cm
questions.E: The patient had a previous C-section

questions.q: At term, the ligaments of the pelvis change. This can result in:
questions.E: Posterior rotation of the levator muscles
questions.explanation: Enlargement of the pelvic cavity will help in the process of delivery

questions.q: During the delivery, the fetal head follows the pelvic axis. The axis is best described as:
questions.B: A curved line, first directed anteriorly then caudal
questions.C: A curved line, first directed posteriorly then caudal
questions.D: A curved line, first directed posteriorly then cephalic

questions.q: In a vertex presentation, the position is determined by the relationship of what fetal part to the mother's pelvis:
Signs of placental separation after delivery include:
questions.B: Changes of uterine shape from discoid to globular
questions.D: Presentation of the placenta at the cervical os
questions.explanation: All the above are signs of placental separation after delivery

questions.q: An unstable lie is related to all of the following EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: Fundal fibroid is above where the fetus lies, though it can cause compression if it increases to a significantly larger size

questions.q: The relation of the fetal parts to one another determines:
The relationship of the long axis of the fetus to the long axis of the mother is called:
Engagement is strictly defined as:
questions.A: When the presenting part goes through the pelvic inlet
questions.B: When the presenting part is level with the ischial spines
questions.C: When the greatest biparietal diameter of the fetal head passes the pelvic inlet
questions.D: When the greatest biparietal diameter of the fetal head is at the level of ischial spines
questions.explanation: Engagement is when the greatest biparietal diameter of the fetal head passes the pelvic inlet

questions.q: The fetal head may undergo changes in shape during normal delivery. The most common etiology listed is:
questions.explanation: Molding helps in the delivery process and passage of the fetus through the pelvic area

questions.q: If the large fontanel is the presenting part, what is the presentation?
Methods of determining fetal presentation & position include:
questions.explanation: Leopoldâ€™s maneuver is used to determine the fetal presentation and position

questions.q: A transverse lie of the fetus is least likely in the presence of:
questions.explanation: A transverse lie is least likely seen in a normal term fetus
